name: eighth

A2 8th written as a word: be/come eighth He was/came eighth in the race.the eighth (of) Bob's birthday is on the eighth (of June).
More examplesFewer examplesRome was founded in the eighth century BC .This is the eighth volume in the series, which totals 21 volumes in all.Between the eighth week of development and birth a human embryo is called a foetus.August is the eighth month of the year.This was my eighth visit to the region.

eighth noun [C]
(FRACTION)
one of eight equal parts of something: An eighth of 32 is 4.

eighth noun [C]
(IN MUSIC)
music
  mainly US specialized (UK usually quaver) a musical note that is half as long as a crotchet: a dotted eighth He plays straight eighths on the snare with accents on the afterbeat. Synonym
eighth note
More examplesFewer examplesSwing eighths divide the beats into uneven eighth notes.The move from triplets to even eighths might be seen as a simplification of metre.This kind of music is written in even measures, but every once in a while there will be seven eighths or five eighths to throw it off.

(in the position of) the number 8 in a series; 8th: He finished eighth in the race. [ C ] Clarice was born on the eighth of August.
An eighth is one of eight equal parts of something.
